=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Virgin Human Hair Lace Front Blonde Wig 18" with Baby Hair for Women Body Wave Glueless Transparent Swiss Frontal Lace Free Part Long Brazilian Hair Pre-plucked 130% Density #613 Bleach Blonde
Review Date: 2018/06/17
Store: Hairro
Average Rating: 3.8
Product Details: {'Material': 'Human Hair', 'Item Dimensions LxWxH': '13.39 x 9.88 x 0.98 inches', 'Hair Type': 'Wavy', 'Style': 'Modern', 'Special Feature': 'Glueless', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'Product Dimensions': '13.39 x 9.88 x 0.98 inches; 7.04 Ounces', 'Item model number': 'SG_B0787RV1KG_US', 'UPC': '750440158372'}
Review Text: Okay let’s start by saying human hair lace front wigs for under $200 are rare. Good ones are almost impossible to find. This one is well worth the money. I ordered the 18” and when I received it (prime 2 days) it looked like a hot mess. Yellow, body wave soft but messy. I colored it with medium ash blond and light ash blond box color. It took the ash color too well! I went back and redid it in pale beige blond and lightened it up. I still need to do platinum highlights and a shadow root. I conditioned, blow dried and straightened with a flat iron. It straightened absolutely beautifully. I cut off about 3” because sadly the ends were too thin. The hair is gorgeous though. I curl it with a 1 1/4” curling iron and it looks great at first but curl doesn’t stay well in humidity. It remains soft smooth and silky though. Now the cap-lace front appears pretty much preplucked. I plucked my part. I did not pluck the edges as they were great as is. Lace melted into my hairline. Cap is comfortable and wefts do not show. Good natural density. My one issue:: this cap is BIG. That’s perfect if you have a bigger head or tons of bio hair but I don’t. I’m a petite average and the bigger circumference on this wig makes it difficult to lay the lace without overlap and buckling. Also the cap itself is a little baggy on me. I make it work but I could never wear it without a wig grip underneath and it’s still biggish. Overall though a great wig for the price!!
Review Title: Great human hair for under $200!
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------

Review Text: Okay let’s start by saying human hair lace front wigs for under $200 are rare. Good ones are almost impossible to find. This one is well worth the money. I ordered the 18” and when I received it (prime 2 days) it looked like a hot mess. Yellow, body wave soft but messy. I colored it with medium ash blond and light ash blond box color. It took the ash color too well! I went back and redid it in pale beige blond and lightened it up. I still need to do platinum highlights and a shadow root. I conditioned, blow dried and straightened with a flat iron. It straightened absolutely beautifully. I cut off about 3” because sadly the ends were too thin. The hair is gorgeous though. I curl it with a 1 1/4” curling iron and it looks great at first but curl doesn’t stay well in humidity. It remains soft smooth and silky though. Now the cap-lace front appears pretty much preplucked. I plucked my part. I did not pluck the edges as they were great as is. Lace melted into my hairline. Cap is comfortable and wefts do not show. Good natural density. My one issue:: this cap is BIG. That’s perfect if you have a bigger head or tons of bio hair but I don’t. I’m a petite average and the bigger circumference on this wig makes it difficult to lay the lace without overlap and buckling. Also the cap itself is a little baggy on me. I make it work but I could never wear it without a wig grip underneath and it’s still biggish. Overall though a great wig for the price!!

raw_response:
SUMMARY:
The individual exhibits a consistent preference for fragrance products, particularly favoring soft and pleasant scents that evoke nostalgic memories, as evidenced by multiple purchases of a specific cologne with high ratings. Sentiments reflect appreciation for the emotional connection and compliment-giving nature of the fragrance, showcasing a strong inclination towards products that deliver a positive sensory experience.

In contrasting categories, such as hair products, the user values quality and functionality. They focus on the practicality of human hair wigs, indicating a preference for items that are versatile and aesthetically pleasing, while remaining conscious of price. Positive mentions about the hair's manageability and ability to take color highlight a desire for high-value items that do not compromise on quality, despite expressing some issues with sizing and initial appearance.

Across interactions, there emerges a theme of balancing quality with affordability. The individual appears willing to invest in products that are well-rated and fulfill their purpose, signaling moderate price sensitivity but a strong aversion to cheap or low-quality solutions. Overall, they favor stylish, evocative, and practical items that reflect a modern aesthetic aligned with personal memories and self-expression.

I curl it with a 1 1/4” curling iron and it looks great at first but curl doesn’t stay well in humidity. It remains soft smooth and silky though. Now the cap-lace front appears pretty much preplucked. I plucked my part. I did not pluck the edges as they were great as is. Lace melted into my hairline. Cap is comfortable and wefts do not show. Good natural density. My one issue:: this cap is BIG. That’s perfect if you have a bigger head or tons of bio hair but I don’t. I’m a petite average and the bigger circumference on this wig makes it difficult to lay the lace without overlap and buckling. Also the cap itself is a little baggy on me. I make it work but I could never wear it without a wig grip underneath and it’s still biggish. Overall though a great wig for the price!!
